frameDefinitions: A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
The Focal_feature is defined in relation to a Landmark_feature, either as a particular part, or as an immediately bordering entity.
This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered.

A Figure is located relative to a (presumably more easily located) Ground, asserting that the Figure lies (approximately) on line from the Ground whose direction is established by semantic types of the particular LUs.
In this frame, there is a Part of a Whole in which the Part is defined with respect to the canonical or inherent orientation of the Whole.
An Emitter emits a Beam of light from a Source, along a Path, and/or towards a Goal.
frameExamples: I'm on the <t>summit</t> of Mt. Shasta.
(1) They took <t>revenge</t> for the deaths of two loyalist prisoners.
The plane landed 10 miles due <t>north</t> of Lake Travis in an empty field .
Avoid allowing light to <t>shine</t> into neighbors' gardens.
listRoleDefinitions: The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
A stable bounded area defined by its relation to another landform. This role is incorporated in each LU in this frame.
The landform with respect to which the <fen>Focal_feature</fen> is defined.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> exacts revenge from the <fen>Offender</fen> for the <fen>Injury</fen>.
The <fen>Offender</fen> has committed the earlier <fen>Injury</fen> for which the <fen>Avenger</fen> seeks revenge.
The <fen>Avenger</fen> carries out a <fen>Punishment</fen> in order to exact revenge on the <fen>Offender</fen>.

The <fen>Injury</fen> is the injurious action committed by the <fen>Offender</fen> against the <fen>Injured_Party</fen>. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary.

This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the <fen>Injury</fen> at the hands of the <fen>Offender</fen>. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the <fen>Injury</fen>. These also constitute instances of  <fen>Injured_party</fen>
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the revenge occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the revenge occurs.
The <fen>Ground</fen> serves as a basis for describing the location of the <fen>Figure</fen>.

The <fen>Figure</fen> is perceived as located relative to a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location in a certain direction specified by the particular LU. The <fen>Figure</fen> can be an entity or an event.
The period of time during which the locative relation between <fen>Figure</fen> and <fen>Ground</fen> obtains.
A piece of a larger <fen>Whole</fen>.
An undivided entity having all its <fen>Part</fen>s.
This role identifies the entity at the <fen>Source</fen> from which the <fen>Beam</fen> originates.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> occupies initially before its change of location.
The light that travels from a <fen>Source</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen>.
<fen>Path</fen> refers to where the <fen>Beam</fen> travels over or to a landmark the <fen>Beam</fen> travels by.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Beam</fen> ends up in.
listRoleExamples: Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
Jo had the affair as a kind of revenge <fex>against Pat</fex>.
The team took revenge <fex>with a resounding victory</fex>.
The team sought revenge <fex>for their 4-1 defeat last month</fex>.
He was north of the park <fex>on Friday</fex>.
The top <fex>shelf</fex> of the bookcase was lying on the floor.
The show takes place in the West wing <fex>of the White House</fex>.
<fex>Sunlight</fex> gleamed from the water of the bay.
